intro: Scordium inerme, commonly known as the common scordium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Scordium inerme is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is not typically cultivated for food but is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
